entry.title: intercompany asset capitalizations which requires a different treatment to a normal 3rd party acquis
entry.content:
HI all, 
will need to have Asset configuration changed to all for intercompany asset capitalizations which requires a different treatment to a normal 3rd party acquisition as it needs to account for GBV and accumulated depreciation of the original company as well as any gains or losses via equity.

This is where an asset in any company is sold to another group company.

The original GBV and Accum depreciation of the seller must be reflected in the receiver books with the movement type being a transfer not a purchase and the purchase price diff to NBV to be posted to Equity.

gibt es eine Idee wie man so etwas lösen kann in HANA?

Best regards
Thomas

entry.title: Merit Calculation Based on Different Current Salary
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

We are working on a new compensation requirement that we hope someone has found a workaround for.

We want to use the standard Merit and Guidelines fields for the merit increase. Based on our investigation, the merit can be calculated either from the standard Current Salary field or from a custom field (ID = meritTarget). However, this custom field must be imported,  it cannot use formulas.

The main challenge is that the Current Salary field can only be mapped to a single pay component / pay component group. In our case, we have two different groups of employees:

  • Some employees have their current salary defined through one pay component group, and
  • Others have their current salary defined through a different pay component.

 We would like to continue using the standard Merit field and Guidelines for the merit increase.

We tried creating a custom field that would pull the appropriate pay component based on each employee’s setup and then use that field for the merit calculation. However, since custom fields can’t contain formulas, this approach doesn’t work.

One idea we are considering (but haven’t tested yet) is to use the Compounding Feature for this purpose. Our idea would be to:

  • Map the standard Current Salary field to the pay component group,
  • Map the standard Extra field to the pay component (this field would not be editable), and
  • Have the standard Merit field based on  the total of these two values (Current Salary + Extra).

However, we are aware that this isn’t the intended use of the Compounding Feature, so we’re not sure if it might cause unexpected behavior.

Has anyone tried a similar approach or found a more stable solution for this scenario? Any insights or best practices would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance for your help!

entry.title: BRF+ Process in SAP S/4 HANA Fiori
entry.content:
BRF+  - Business Rule Framework Plus

Introduction:

  • BRF+ stands for Business Rule Framework plus which Provides a comprehensive application programming interface and user interface for defining business rules.
  • It enables you to define business rules without the need of writing ABAP Code.
  • BRF+ Function provides an interface between a business rule modelled with BRF+ and an application using that rule. The BRF+ function serves as a container for the entire business logic of a rule.
  • BRF+ is not new and even not directly related to SAP S/4HANA, but with the release of SAP S/4HANA 1610, BRF+ gained more attention since it is launched as the go-to solution for some business processes. The most important ones are the changes in Output Management for purchasing and Billing.
  • In order to use BRF+ with your SAP ECC system, your system must be on SAP NetWeaver 7.02 SP6 or above.
  • BRF+ supports features such as simulation, trace, transport, XML, export and import.
  • With SAP S/4 HANA a new Output Management Approach is in place. The complete configuration differs from the configuration that is used when Output Management is based on NAST (condition technique). The configuration is based on BRF+ in SAP S/4HANA is the target architecture is based on Adobe Document server and Adobe forms only. For the Form Determination Rules (along with other output parameters) BRF+ functionality is used.
  • Rules are Implemented as expressions which are assigned to the function. The rule input is known as “Context ”, and the rule output is called “Result”.
  • It is a part of SAP NetWeaver ABAP Stack.

Key Benefits:

All output parameters can be automatically determined via a configuration activity based on BRFplus. The benefits are:

  • You can send multiple messages to multiple recipients using multiple channels at the same time.
  • You can configure anything without the need for ABAP exits.
  • You can use each determination step on application-specific fields that can be extended.
  • You can use pre-delivered content/determination rules to simply run output control out of the box.
  • Extensibility via CDS is supported.

Important Note: Basis Team need to upload Standard XML Forms in SAP system. They import the forms by using BRF+ Transaction code.

If the forms aren't uploaded, we won't be able to see the Output Type in the OPD Transaction.

We can get the details of Form from SAP Note: 2248229 with the help of Basis download the note.

Here I am attaching the standard forms available in the SAP Note.

 

Limitations in BRF+:

  • Idocs are not fully supported by the New Output Management. Their use is restricted to business applications that previously used NAST.
  • Only output types which can be mapped 1:1 to the NAST-KSCHL can use IDoc.
  • Only business partner-based communication is supported, but no communication to logical systems.
  • No ALE supports.
  • BRF+ doesn't fully integrate with the document management features provided by earlier SAP systems like SAP script or Smart Forms.
  • Compared to older output management solutions, error handling and debugging can be a bit more complex or less intuitive in BRF+.
  • It requires better integration of monitoring tools and workflows to identify issues with output processes, especially when compared to more established NAST error handling.

The main reason to use BRF+ Output Management is used instead of the traditional NACE-based output determination in S/4HANA as NACE is deprecated and no longer supported for many document types. BRF+ offers a modern, flexible, and rule-based approach to manage outputs such as emails and print forms and is fully integrated with the S/4HANA and Fiori environment.

Comparison between BRF+ and Standard Output Determination (NACE)

Feature / Criteria

NACE (Legacy Output)

BRF+ (S/4HANA Output Management)

Technology Base

Table-driven configuration

Rule-based framework (BRF+ engine)

User Interface

SAP GUI (transaction NACE)

Web-based Fiori app and OPD (Output Parameter Determination)

Document Type Support

Supported in SAP ECC and some S/4HANA scenarios

Standard in SAP S/4HANA (especially Fiori apps)

Flexibility

Limited (fixed condition types, access sequences)

High (custom rules, formulas, context-based logic)

Output Channels Supported

Mainly Print, Fax, Email

Print, Email, XML, IDoc, Archive, etc.

Form Template Integration

SAPscript / SmartForms

Adobe Forms (PDF-based, integrated with Fiori)

Fiori App Compatibility

Not supported in many Fiori apps

Fully supported and recommended for Fiori apps

Configuration Effort

Complex, often requires developer support

Functional-driven setup, less technical dependency

Audit and Traceability

Limited

Rule trace & test simulation available

Future Readiness (SAP Direction)

Deprecated in S/4HANA

SAP standard going forward (recommended by SAP)

NAST to BRF+ Conversion Overview:

There are several updates and enhancements in SAP regarding the conversion from NAST to BRF+ for output management.

  1. Mandatory Use of BRF+ for Certain Documents:
  • With the release of SAP S/4HANA 1511, output management using BRF+ became mandatory for Purchase Orders. Similarly, in later versions, BRF+ is required for managing outputs of Sales Orders and Billing documents, replacing the traditional NAST-based output management.
  1. Increased Number of Supported XML Forms:
  • In earlier versions like SAP S/4HANA 1709, over 12 XML forms were supported. This number has significantly increased in subsequent versions, with SAP S/4HANA 1909 supporting over 20 XML forms. This expansion allows for a broader range of output types and formats to be managed using BRF+.
  1. Simplified Configuration and Integration:
  • The configuration process for BRF+ has been streamlined to reduce complexity. It allows for the easy import of XML files for output determination, simplifying the setup and customization of output types.
  1. Integration with SAP Fiori and Other UI Technologies:
  • BRF+ integrates seamlessly with SAP Fiori applications and other UI technologies like SAP GUI and SAP UI5. This integration ensures a consistent and modern user experience across different platforms.

In NAST, the configuration path that needs to be maintained is quite complex. The steps need to be followed are:

  1. Condition Table
  2. Access Sequence
  3. Condition Type
  4. Output Type
  5. Condition Record

For the BRF+ in S/4 HANA it is even simplified even business user can maintain Decision Table.

The steps need to follow are:

  1. Output Type
  2. Receiver
  3. Channel
  4. Printer Settings
  5. Email Settings
  6. Form Template

We maintain this configuration because it enables the use of SAP S/4HANA-based output management for Purchase Orders (POs), which is necessary for integrating with other systems like the Ariba Network and managing output messages efficiently in the SAP environment.

  • Even if you do not activate the specific step for SAP S/4HANA-Based Output Management related to integration with the Ariba Network, BRF+ (Business Rule Framework Plus) can still be used in SAP.

Configuration Path: SPRO→ IMG → Integration with Other SAP Components → Business Network Integration → Integration with the Ariba Network Application-specific settings → Define Message Output Control → Method 2: Use SAP S/4HANA-Based Output Management → Activate or Deactivate SAP S/4HANA-Based Output Management

To activate the mode, select "New Output Management is Active" from the dropdown menu and click Save.

Configuration steps:

  1. Storage repository settings
  2. Manage Application Object Type Activation
  3. Define Output Types
  4. Assign Output Channels
  5. Define Rules for Determination of Master Form Template
  6. Assign Form Templates
  7. Assign Email Templates
  8. Define Business Rules for Output Parameter Determination

Storage repository settings:

Configuration:  SPRO > Cross-Application Components > Document Management > General Data > Settings for Storage Systems > Maintain Storage System

SOMU_DB  is a standard content Repository for Output Management DB Storage.

If you can’t find the standard content Repository, click on the create tab and maintain the data mentioned below:

Content Repository: SOMU_DB  

Storage Type: SAP System

Version: 0047

If you want to customize, select the standard one and click on Copy as tab as shown change the content Repository name and click on save.

Manage Application Object Type Activation

Configuration: SPRO –> IMG –> Cross-Application Components -> Output Control -> Manage Application Object Type Activation

If you can’t see the standard Application object type in the screen, just click on Entries  and click on Help button and select the required Application object type as per the requirement and maintain status as active and click on save.

Define Output Types:

Configuration: SPRO –> IMG –> Cross-Application Components -> Output Control -> Define Output Types

The standard configuration is already set up. If the standard option is not visible, you can add it by clicking on "New Entries." To modify the output type, select the standard one, click "Copy As," assign the output type to the Application Object Type, and then save the changes.

Assign Output Channels:

Configuration: SPRO –> IMG –> Cross-Application Components –> Output Control –> Assign Output Channels

In this step we can assign output channels to application object type and output type.

Define Rules for Determination of Master Form Template

Configuration: : SPRO –> IMG –> Cross-Application Components –> Output Control –> Define Rules for Determination of Master Form Template

This step is used to establish rules that determine which master form template should be applied based on specific conditions or criteria.

In the "Define Rules for Determination of Master Form Template" step in BRF+, we maintain the rules and conditions that link specific criteria, such as document type, application area, or other relevant factors, to determine the appropriate master form template to be used.

Assign Form Templates:

Configuration: SPRO –> IMG –> Cross-Application Components –> Output Control –> Assign Form Templates

This step is used to link specific form templates to the rules or processes defined in BRF+. This step ensures that the correct form template is associated with a particular business scenario or document type based on the logic defined in the earlier steps, such as the "Define Rules for Determination of Master Form Template" step.

It enables the system to dynamically assign the appropriate form template for generating documents, reports, or outputs based on the conditions set in the rule framework.

After Maintaining the data click on save.

Assign Form Template:

 Configuration: SPRO –> IMG –> Cross-Application Components –> Output Control –> Assign Form Template

This step ensures that the correct form template is associated with a particular business scenario or document type based on the logic defined in the earlier steps, such as the "Define Rules for Determination of Master Form Template" step.

After Maintaining the data click on save.

Define Business Rules for Output Parameter Determination

Configuration: Configuration: SPRO –> IMG –> Cross-Application Components –> Output Control –> Define Business Rules for Output Parameter Determination

I won’t see the option for Purchase contract. So, I need to add template related to purchase contract in BRF+ Transaction code.

In settings select User Mode: Expert

In the Tools tab, choose the XML import, add the standard XML form for the Purchase contract, and include the transport requests.
The Customizing Request will store all the configuration settings for BRF+ that have been maintained.
The Workbench Request will store the configuration settings for Output Types.

Now, the Purchase Contract option is visible in the Output Parameter Determination.

For each step, click on Edit Tab and Maintain the appropriate data and click on Activate button.

The system will display a pop-up tab like want to activate the Output Type click on yes.

It will remain empty because the Email Recipient will be selected from the vendor master data maintained during vendor creation.

Once all the configurations are maintained. Create the Purchase Contract in SAP Fiori.

Use the search bar to look for the tile named “Purchase Contract”, then select the appropriate tile from the search results to proceed.

On the initial screen, maintain the mandatory fields such as Supplier, Agreement Type, Purchasing Organization, and other necessary details before proceeding.

Top of Form

Bottom of Form

Enter the Validity Dates and Target Value, then press Enter to continue.

Once all the required data has been entered, click on Save to complete the process.

The system displays a pop-up message confirming that the Value Contract has been successfully created.

To make changes to an existing contract, navigate to the Menu > Outline Agreement > Change option from the initial screen. This allows you to modify the existing contract details.

Enter the Agreement Number in the input field and click on the Overview button to proceed.

Click on the Messages button to view or maintain output messages, as shown in the screenshot.

The status will display as In Preparation.

To check the print preview, click on the Display Document tab as shown.

To set the status to complete, select the line and click on the send Output tab as shown.

The status will change to “To be Output”

 After completion of this step come back and click on save the status will change to completed.

The system will displays a pop-up tab confirming that Value Contract is changed.

Enter the Agreement Number and click on Enter.

Click on Message to view the output status details.

The status will be changed from the To Be Output to Completed.

entry.title: Time Management Revolution: Latest Innovations and What's Coming Next
entry.content:
The Current Landscape: By the Numbers 

SAP SuccessFactors Time Management has reached an impressive scale globally. With over 4,400 time-off customers and more than 11 million users worldwide using Time Management capabilities across mobile and web platforms, the industry has demonstrated massive adoption and trust. 

 

What's particularly exciting is the innovation trajectory: Time-off Management has reached impressive maturity, while Time Tracking is rapidly gaining momentum as the newest advancement in workforce technology. Since its 2021 launch, Time Tracking has attracted 1,100+ forward-thinking customers and stands ready to revolutionize workforce management as organizations embrace cloud transformation. 

 

One notable success story is a large global customer with recent implementation in 2025, serving over 300,000 users - a testament to how these solutions can scale to meet enterprise-level demands while adapting to country-specific requirements. 

 

The Evolution: From Basic Tracking to AI-Powered Intelligence 

2021: The Foundation 

The journey began with essential features that form the backbone of modern time management: 

  • Clock-in/Clock-out functionality with single record approval 
  • Work-from-home support with dedicated workflows 
  • Weekly timesheet UI for easy submission 
  • Seamless payroll integration ensuring accurate, timely payments 
  • Cross-midnight support for night shift premiums and overtime calculations 

 

2022: Adding Precision and Complexity 

As organizations demanded more sophisticated tracking, new capabilities emerged: 

  • Location capture with GPS to verify work locations 
  • Robust time valuation systems handling complex collective agreements 
  • Late arrival detection and rest period monitoring 
  • Public holiday pattern support for 24/7 operations like hospitals and Police Department .  

Example :Organizations with such employee groups typically need to cover such cases. In a hospital, for example, nurses need to be present even on public holidays whereas the hospital accountant for example doesn’t need to work on a public holiday. 

 

2024: The AI Revolution 

The introduction of artificial intelligence marked a turning point. Joule, our AI copilot, enables natural language interactions, allowing employees to ask questions like: 

  • "What's my vacation balance for planning my summer break?" 
  • "What does my holiday calendar look like for the next quarter?" 
  • "Help me request time off for next Friday" 

The beauty of Joule lies in its cross-platform capabilities - you can access time management features from other SAP modules, creating a truly integrated experience. 

 

Recent Game-Changing Innovations 

Enhanced Timesheet Experience 

Flexible Periods: Organizations can now choose from weekly, biweekly, or monthly timesheet periods that align perfectly with their payroll cycles. This is particularly valuable for: 

  • German companies requiring monthly timesheet periods 
  • Manufacturing and construction companies for example operating on biweekly cycles 

Quick-Fill Capabilities: The new copy and quick-create functions allow employees to generate entire two-week periods of working time in one action, dramatically reducing administrative time. 

Smart Workflows: Enhanced single record approval now includes cancellation workflows, allowing employees to modify or cancel previously submitted requests when plans change. 

 

Timesheet Approval Center: A Manager's Command Hub 

This centralized dashboard transforms how managers oversee their teams by providing: 

  • Real-time deviation alerts when employees haven't recorded time or have recording errors 
  • Mass approval capabilities for efficient timesheet processing 
  • Configurable key facts tailored to different employee groups (shift workers vs. flexible employees) 
  • Anomaly detection for policy violations like excessive overtime or rest period breaches 

 

Future Roadmap: 2025-2026 and Beyond 

For details on roadmap and upcoming innovations, please do have a look here in roadmap explorer 

SAP Road Map Explorer 

 

Immediate Innovations (2025) 

Geofencing Technology Addresses time fraud and ensures accurate location-based tracking by: 

  • Creating customizable boundaries around work sites 
  • Preventing clock-ins from unauthorized locations (like parking lots or nearby cafes) 
  • Supporting various shapes (circular, polygonal) to match actual building layouts 
  • Providing real-time distance feedback to employees 

Consolidated Time Recording Bridges the gap between time tracking and project management by: 

  • Unifying timesheets for both HR policies and project billing 
  • Seamlessly integrating with SAP S4 HANA for cost allocation 
  • Supporting absence recording within project timesheets 
  • Eliminating the need to switch between multiple applications 

Automated payouts with periodic time account updates helps with 

  • Regional Labor Policies 
    Help organizational requirements in regions like Germany and other parts of Europe meet local regulations where periodic monitoring and capping of working time account balances is mandatory. 
  • Automated Excess Hours Payout 
    Companies can configure thresholds (e.g., 40 hours), and any excess (e.g., 20 hours) is automatically paid out - eliminating manual tracking and ensuring timely compensation. 
  • Flexible Pay Component Distribution 
    Excess hours can be split across multiple pay components based on company policy (e.g., first 15 hours at 25%, remaining 5 hours at 50% or 75%), offering granular control over payouts. 
  • Seamless Payroll Integration 
    Payouts flow directly into payroll systems like SAP ECP or On-Prem Payroll (e.g., Infotype 15 or 416), ensuring accurate and efficient processing. 
  • Fully Automated & Error-Free Process 
    No manual intervention is needed from administrators—saving time, reducing errors, and improving overall operational efficiency. 

ESS Timesheet Audit Documents provides transparency with audit  

  • Employees can directly view who made changes to their timesheet and when—fostering trust and clarity in time recording practices. 
  • Helps organizations meet legal requirements such as SOX Section 404, US FLSA, and DCAA timekeeping standards by providing auditable records accessible to the individual concerned. 
  • By giving employees visibility into their change history, it minimizes misunderstandings and potential conflicts during internal or external audits 

 

Globalization needs: 

Leave in Weeks – Country-Specific Enhancement for Australia 

  • Aligns with state-specific regulations (e.g., NSW, Victoria, Queensland) that mandate LSL to be recorded and taken in weeks, helping organizations avoid penalties and remain compliant. 
  • Reduces complexity in translating hours or days into weeks manually, streamlining payroll processes and improving accuracy in leave tracking and reporting. 

 

FMLA Leave Tracking helps admins with 

  • Provide visibility into FMLA requests from third party vendors via intuitive dashboard  
  • Flexible configuration of absence types and sequences using FMLA Reasons  
  • Tracking and monitoring of leave patterns of employees 

 

 

More Planned Innovations 

 

SAP SuccessFactors Workforce Scheduling (Manufacturing Focus) 

A collaboration between time management and digital manufacturing intends to deliver: 

  • Skills-based scheduling integrated with SuccessFactors Talent Intelligence Hub 
  • Workforce availability with regards to absences and holidays flowing from SuccessFactors  
  • Demand-driven shift planning based on production requirements 
  • Employee self-service for shift preferences and swapping 
  • Real-time notification systems for schedule changes 
  • HR Policy violation alerts for rest periods and overtime limits 

 

Advanced Analytics with Business Data Cloud (BDC) 

Moving beyond transactional reporting plans to provide: 

  • Cross-modular insights combining time data with performance management 
  • Financial impact analysis of unplanned leave and overtime costs 
  • Productivity metrics and trend analysis 

 

Key Benefits Organizations Can Expect 

 

  1. Improved Accuracy: Automated time valuations reduce human error in payroll calculations 
  1. Enhanced Compliance: Built-in rules help to adhere to labor regulations and collective agreements 
  1. Increased Efficiency: Streamlined approval processes and bulk operations save administrative time 
  1. Better Insights: Advanced analytics provide actionable intelligence for workforce optimization 
  1. Employee Satisfaction: Self-service capabilities and transparent processes improve user experience 

 

Getting Ready for the Future 

 

As these innovations roll out, organizations should consider: 

Assessing Current Needs: Evaluate which features align with your workforce composition and industry requirements 

Planning Migrations: For on-premises users, develop transition strategies to cloud-based solutions 

Training Programs: Prepare managers and employees for new interfaces and capabilities 

Policy Reviews: Update company policies to leverage new automation and control features 

Integration Planning: Consider how time management will connect with other business systems 

 

Conclusion 

The future of time management is moving toward intelligent, integrated systems that serve both organizational needs and employee experience. With AI-powered assistance and advanced analytics, these innovations promise to transform time tracking from a necessary administrative task into a strategic business capability. 

As we move through 2025 and beyond, organizations that embrace these innovations will find themselves better equipped to manage complex workforce requirements, ensure compliance, and optimize productivity - all while providing employees with more intuitive, transparent, and flexible time management experiences. 

The key is to stay informed about these developments and plan strategically for implementation. The time management revolution is here, and it's reshaping how we think about workforce optimization in the digital age. 

 

Additional information was provided in a recent webinar, and you can access the webinar recording & slides that were presented here:  

Webinar Replay - SuccessFactors Time Management: Latest Innovations & What’s Next 

 

For the latest updates on time management innovations and release schedules, please keep an eye on the SAP community pages where detailed information and implementation guides are regularly published.

entry.title: Re: Enterprise Messaging in SAP: JMS vs Event Mesh vs AMQP Adapter
entry.content:
AMQP stands for Advanced Message Queuing Protocol 
AMQP adapter acts as a bridge, enabling your application to connect to AMQP-compliant message brokers like RabbitMQ or Apache Qpid, so that your application can send or receive messages reliably, asynchronously, and in a decoupled manner.

example : You can think of the AMQP adapter in a similar way to an HTTP adapter—both serve as connectors or bridges that facilitate communication between different systems using their respective protocols.

entry.title: Re: Unable to open report generation activity from run st...
entry.content:
Dear all,

 

Please note, if a submission involves more than one type, we define separate phases when creating the category. The standard phases, which must be submitted to the authority, are common across all reports.

There are two types of phases available for a report category:

  1. Declaration Phase: This is the default (standard) phase for all report submissions.

  2. Correction Phase: After completing the Declaration Phase, correction files can be created. There can be multiple Correction Phases for submission, depending on the requirements.

entry.title: SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) — безкоштовні можливості
entry.content:
Безкоштовні ресурси SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP): можливості для розробників та бізнесу

Навчальні ресурси SAP допоможуть зрозуміти, як поєднувати дані, процеси та інновації на одній платформі, створювати застосунки без коду, використовувати аналітику та ШІ у власних рішеннях — усе це можна робити безкоштовно та у власному темпі.

У часи, коли бізнесу потрібна гнучкість, швидкість та технологічна інтеграція, особливе значення мають платформи, що поєднують дані, процеси та аналітику. Саме такою платформою є SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP).

SAP BTP — це комплексна платформа для інтеграції, автоматизації, розширення та створення бізнес-застосунків і процесів на базі ШІ у всіх підрозділах підприємства. Вона дає змогу розробникам, аналітикам і бізнес-командам створювати, розширювати та підключати інтелектуальні рішення як на базі SAP, так і сторонніх систем.

Для українських ІТ-фахівців і компаній SAP відкриває безкоштовний доступ до навчальних матеріалів і демо-середовищ, щоб можна було експериментувати з технологіями, створювати прототипи та розвивати власну експертизу.

Безкоштовні освітні та довідкові ресурси SAP BTP

Навчальні ресурси SAP допоможуть розробникам не лише ознайомитися з платформою та її можливостями, а й отримати практичний досвід у створенні застосунків, роботі з аналітикою та інтеграцією даних.

Нижче наведено основні безкоштовні ресурси та навчальні матеріали, які дозволяють українським фахівцям почати працювати з SAP BTP, розширити свої навички та отримати сертифікацію.

  • SAP BTP Trial — це можливість отримати 90-денний безкоштовний доступ до повного набору сервісів платформи SAP Business Technology Platform. Тут можна створювати, розгортати та інтегрувати власні рішення, виконувати практичні місії та навчальні завдання, а також протестувати можливості штучного інтелекту за допомогою SAP Build Code.
  • SAP Learning Hub – BTP Edition — онлайн-платформа для навчання з SAP BTP; містить інтерактивні курси, навчальні матеріали та готові навчальні шляхи для початківців і досвідчених користувачів.
  • SAP BTP Tutorials — покрокове практичне навчання, яке дозволяє швидко освоїти основнісервіси та сценарії використання платформи.
  • SAP BTP Webinars — онлайн-семінари з експертами SAP, які охоплюють новинки платформи, кращі практики та реальні кейси впровадження.
  • SAP Community – BTP Topics — спільнота користувачів та експертів SAP BTP; можна ставити питання, ділитися досвідом та знаходити практичні поради від професіоналів.
  • SAP BTP Developer’s Guide — детальна документація для розробників; пояснює, як працювати з сервісами платформи, створювати та інтегрувати застосунки.
  • SAP BTP Documentation — офіційна документація платформи; включає технічні описи сервісів, API, інструкції з налаштування та використання.
  • SAP BTP Blog — блог з новинами, аналітикою та порадами щодо SAP BTP; допомагає слідкувати за розвитком платформи та трендами у хмарних технологіях.
  • SAP BTP Guidance Framework — структуровані рекомендації та шаблони для впровадження рішень на платформі; допомагає швидко стартувати і уникати типових помилок.
  • SAP BTP Free Tier Model — опис безкоштовного рівня доступу до сервісів BTP; дозволяє тестувати платформи та інструменти без комерційних витрат.
  • SAP BTP and GenAI — Strategy and Vision презентація підходу SAP до генеративного ШІ; розповідає, як інтегрувати ШІ у бізнес-процеси через SAP BTP.

Навчальні програми

  • Discover SAP Business Technology Platform (9 модулів, безкоштовно) — після завершення курсу розробники, консультанти та адміністратори отримають базові знання SAP Business Technology Platform: можливості інтеграції та розширення додатків за допомогою інтелектуальних технологій, включення аналітики, адміністрування баз даних і управління даними. А також — уявлення про аспекти безпеки та управління сталим розвитком.
  • SAP BTP Kyma Learning Path — учасники отримають практичні знання з Kubernetes у контексті SAP BTP, дізнаються про ключові компоненти Kyma та навчаться створювати стійкі та масштабовані додатки для інтеграції з системами SAP. Курс готує розробників до ефективної роботи з платформою та реалізації реальних хмарних рішень і розширень.

Сертифікації

  • SAP Certified Professional – Solution Architect – SAP BTP (P_BTPA_2408) — після завершення навчання можна отримати сертифікацію для фахівців, які володіють знаннями та навичками з проєктування та реалізації рішень на SAP Business Technology Platform. Сертифікація підтверджує здатність інтегрувати сервіси BTP, розробляти розширення та забезпечувати ефективну архітектуру хмарних застосунків у корпоративному середовищі.
  • Comprehensive Guide to SAP BTP Certifications — надає детальну інформацію про доступні сертифікації, вимоги та шляхи отримання кваліфікацій для роботи з SAP BTP.

Ці ресурси — чудовий старт для українських розробників, стартапів та ІТ-компаній, які хочуть експериментувати з технологіями. SAP надає відкриту екосистему для тестування ШІ, створення застосунків і аналітики — безкоштовно. Це можливість навчатися, розвивати власну компетенцію та будувати рішення, що підтримують цифрову трансформацію бізнесу в Україні.

Більше інформації про можливості SAP BTP для українських розробників та практичні приклади використання low-code/no-code рішень читайте у статті “Революція доступності: як SAP BTP Low-Code/No-Code відкриває світ IT для кожного”.

entry.title: Re: Script long text editing in QM01/QM02
entry.content:
Hello there

I get nervous when I get such questions/requests to 'automate'. The notification process is very well integrated into the rest of QM. What exactly are you trying to automate?

But coming back to your question. The relevant objects/IDs are:

  • Header
    Text object QMEL
    TextID LTQM
  • Item
    Text object QMFE
    TextID LTQM
  • Task
    Text object QMSM
    TextID LTQM
  • Activity
    Text object QMMA
    TextID LTQM
  • Cause
    Text object QMUR
    TextID LTQM

Nevertheless, you will not have much joy with this: SAP GUI scripting does not support text controls. The only way (AFAIK) to get this to work is to change the text editor to the old line based-editor. 

Why don't you use BAPI_QUALNOT_CREATE? Don't forget BAPI_QUALNOT_SAVE + BAPI_TRANSACTION_COMMIT afterwards.

entry.title: Want to Explore SAP Customer Data Platform Essentials?
entry.content:
I recommend to access our Exploring SAP Customer Data Platform Essentials course.

Learning Outcome

After completing this course, you will be able to:

  • Define customer data and customer data platform.
  • Navigate the console to successfully configure SAP Customer Data Platform's functionalities.
  • Recognize and relate the four-step process: Data Ingestion, Identity Resolution, Insights, and Engagement and how this process helps to understand the customer.
  • Identify and outline the structure of a Customer Schema concept to create a new attribute in Profile Entity, followed by the creation of a new Activity with attributes.
  • Examine and determine how to integrate source and destination applications, using the repository of applications and platforms in the Application Library.
  • Configure events setup.
  • Configure matching and merging rules.
  • Create data insights to calculate metrics and classify customers.
  • Execute engagement and activation.
  • Design and implement CX Journeys and Flows.

Goals

  • Get started with SAP: Building the basics 
  • Develop your expertise: Skill deepening learning
  • Excel in your expertise: Advanced specialization learning

Please post you question related to the digital course in the Q&A area. 

Our SAP Learning Experts will get back to you as soon as possible! 
We are here to support you.

I appreciate your feedback and we will make sure to continue sharing interesting topics.

Kind regards, Alena

entry.title: Re: Worklist plugin, show customer name
entry.content:
Hi,

i think there could be two solutions:

  1. Add a custom field to the order, populate it with the required customer details within the IDOC LOIPRO using XSLT, and configure it to be displayed in the Worklist plugin.
    When custom fields are defined, the system will automatically make them available as selectable columns in the Worklist List table view.

     

  2. Another approach—which is relatively simple but requires development skills—is to extend the standard SAP core plugins via SAP BTP --> I suggest using the guide provided by Manoel.

entry.title: Re: Calling Integration Suite ODATA APIs from ODATA Receiver
entry.content:
This is an older issue, but I hope this information helps someone.

Sean, I believe you may have misunderstood how the Resource field works. The "/api/v1/" path should not be included in the Resource field itself—it needs to be specified in the Address field (root URL) instead. Following this approach should resolve the error you encountered.

On a related note, I'm experiencing an issue when using the ODataV2 receiver adapter with the DataStore resource. It appears that the EDMX/metadata for MessageStore API is missing this resource. This is evident not only at runtime but also when examining the EDMX file downloaded from the SAP API Business Hub—the resource is absent there as well. Interestingly, the OpenAPI specification does include it. As a workaround, I've switched to using the HTTP adapter, which works perfectly.

br

Mateusz

entry.title: Re: Dynamic mapping of 3rd party applications with SAP Bu...
entry.content:
To enable dynamic mapping between any third-party application (Shopify, Magento, etc.) and SAP Business One using SAP CPI, these steps can help - 

1. Use a metadata-driven mapping approach stored externally (e.g., JSON or database) that defines how fields from each third-party application's data structure map to SAP Business One fields. This metadata can be updated or switched when changing the third party without needing to recreate mappings in CPI.

2. SAP CPI supports integration flows where you can invoke dynamic message transformation using external scripts or lookups against a central mapping repository (JSON files or records) to apply the appropriate mapping based on the source system.

3. Use SAP CPI to connect to various 3rd party systems (Shopify via GraphQL, Magento via APIs) and use integration processes that retrieve data from these systems, apply the dynamic mapping based on the metadata for the current 3rd party, and push into SAP Business One.

4. Staging tables or intermediate steps can be used for complex transformations, allowing you to manipulate and validate data once fetched before final persistence.

5. The JSON file or mapping repository holds mapping rules (field mappings, transformations, conversions) for each 3rd party source. When switching from Shopify to Magento, you update the mapping metadata file rather than changing CPI integration code.

6. Integration platforms like appseconnect or celigo, and approaches recommended in SAP forums align with this pattern, promoting reusable, flexible integration logic with externalized mappings for multiple eCommerce and ERP systems.

This approach minimizes redundant work and enhances integration flexibility and maintainability and the design provides a scalable, low-maintenance dynamic mapping solution for integrating various third-party apps with SAP Business One via SAP CPI.

entry.title: Struggling to Choose the Right Cloud ERP Solution — Need Expert Opinions!
entry.content:
Hey everyone,

I’m hoping to tap into the collective wisdom of this community because I’m currently stuck in a major decision phase for our company’s digital transformation journey.

We’re a mid-sized manufacturing firm, and our decade-old on-premise ERP system is no longer cutting it. Between manual processes, limited integration, and zero scalability, it’s clear we need to move to a Cloud ERP solution — but picking the right one has been way more challenging than expected.

Here’s our current situation and what we’re trying to solve

  • We need better integration between ERP, CRM, and production systems.
    Our team is distributed across multiple locations — so remote accessibility is key.
  • We’re looking for real-time reporting, automation, and AI-driven insights.
  • Our staff isn’t very tech-savvy, so the user experience and training process matter a lot.
  • We have a moderate budget — cost efficiency and transparency are top priorities.

The Challenges

  • Integration complexity: We already use a custom CRM and a legacy production system.
  • Data migration: Our current data is scattered and not well-structured.
  • User adoption: Our workforce isn’t used to major tech shifts.
  • Implementation cost and timeline: We’ve seen horror stories about ERP projects going over budget and schedule.

What I’d Love to Hear From You

If you’ve recently implemented or migrated to a Cloud ERP (especially in manufacturing, supply chain, or retail), could you share:

  • How did you choose your vendor and what tipped the decision?
  • What hidden challenges came up during migration and rollout?
  • How long before you saw tangible ROI or operational improvements?
  • Any mistakes or lessons learned you wish you knew earlier?

entry.title: Re: How to use Time Recording Calendar for submitting Tim...
entry.content:
Yes, based on our understanding, the matching mechanism works for both current and past timesheets—even when the timesheet dates overlap within the calendar dates. This behavior is as designed. Currently, it does not support future timesheets, as we haven’t encountered such use cases from other customers so far. It appears to be a niche or unique scenario.

Regarding the statement:
“Problem comes with a payroll area that is paid up-to-date. For that group of people, the time data needs to be made available in advance, as they need a lot of time to complete their payroll process.”
I’m not entirely clear on the business case here. Specifically, what does “a lot of time” mean in this context? It might be related to process efficiency on the payroll side, and perhaps there’s an opportunity to evaluate whether certain payroll tasks could be automated to reduce time pressure.

That said, since this seems to be a one-off case occurring annually, you might consider a workaround using Integration Center to trigger notifications for employees and admins on a specific day via MDF alerts. This would at least ensure that relevant stakeholders are informed in advance and can submit the necessary timesheets accordingly.

Example : https://community.sap.com/t5/human-capital-management-blog-posts-by-sap/timely-time-sheet-alerts-for-no-records-on-previous-working-day/ba-p/13509861

entry.title: Join the Data and Analytics Value Map on SAP Community
entry.content:
SAP Enterprise Support Value Maps have moved to SAP Community. Join us now in the SAP Community Groups to stay up to date and informed on the SAP Enterprise Support portfolio for Data and Analytics, ranging from Expert-guided implementation (EGI) sessions, Continuous Quality Check (CQC) services, E-learnings, SAP Enterprise Support Advisory Council pilot programs and more.

The Data and Analytics Value Map provides guidance for solutions including SAP Business Data Cloud, SAP Analytics Cloud, SAP Datasphere, SAP Business Warehouse, SAP HANA Cloud, SAP Databricks, as well as SAP BusinessObjects. To see our new look in the SAP Community, watch the short SAP video (1 min, 30): SAP Enterprise Support Value Maps on SAP Community

 

How to Access

  • To access the SAP Enterprise Support Value Maps Group, you must login to SAP Community with an S-user ID or a Universal ID
  • Navigate to us via the tab “Groups”, then “Customer Only Groups” or via our dedicated page: SAP Enterprise Support Value Maps

  • Once in the SAP Enterprise Support Value Maps Group, select the Data and Analytics Value Map and click “Join Group”
  • Expand the “Options” button and click “Subscribe” to get email notifications of activity within the group
  • Why join and subscribe? To set customization preferences, get notifications, participate in the group and have a better user experience

 

Blog Posts

We will continue to post blogs to let you know about availability of new and updated content in the SAP Enterprise Support portfolio, such as new E-Learnings, events taking place, best practices, and other relevant information for the Data and Analytics topic.

 

Knowledge Base

Our Knowledge Base is a collection of documents, which provide both foundational information and in-depth guidance for SAP Data and Analytics topics including SAP Business Data Cloud. These focused documents organize the Expert-guided implementation (EGI) sessions, Continuous Quality Check (CQC) services, E-learnings, best practices, and more by topic. Making it easier for you to see in one place the SAP Enterprise Support offerings by topic and/or solution area. Here are three Knowledge Base directories to bookmark within the Data and Analytics Value Map:   

  • SAP Business Data Cloud Directory
  • SAP Data Warehousing Directory
  • SAP BusinessObjects BI 2025 Directory

 

Q&A

Use the Q&A section to ask us questions or find questions that have already been answered. For example, maybe you need guidance on how to find best practices and make use of the SAP Enterprise Support offerings for your project such as a BW modernization in SAP Business Data Cloud. The following could be relevant for you: 

  • EGI for SAP BW Modernization with SAP Business Data Cloud
  • CQC for Private Cloud Go-Live 
  • CQC for Implementation
  • CQC Technical Performance Optimization (TPO)
  • CQC Business Process Performance Optimization (BPPO)
  • CQC for Security Optimization
  • CQC for Data Volume Management

Full details are in the Knowledge Base SAP BW Modernization with Foundational Support

 

Events

The monthly EGI schedule will be populated here giving details of the planned EGI topics, dates, time, regions and languages.

 

Request a Call

Request a call with one of our topic experts to connect with the right content and resources.

 

LIVE SESSIONS on SAP Enterprise Support value maps – Our Move to SAP Community

Join this live session on October 22, 2025, to learn more, where we will demo SAP Enterprise Support value maps on SAP Community. 🔗 Link to join / Watch Replay

 
Enhance Your SAP Experience with Value Maps 

SAP Enterprise Support offers additional resources to help you drive innovation. SAP Enterprise Support value maps provide expert-led resources, tailored recommendations, and advisory services - all included in your SAP cloud subscription. Get started today:

  • One-time sign up for SAP Learning Hub, edition for SAP Enterprise Support, using a valid S-User ID (please allow up to 2 hours for processing)
  • Access SAP Enterprise Support value maps for personalized guidance
  • Request a call with our solution area experts for tailored advice

Value Maps are part of SAP Enterprise Support commitment to your success. Visit the SAP Enterprise Support value maps landing page to explore our range of topics and start engaging with us today.

 

About the author: 
Caroline Sheridan is a Topic Expert for SAP Enterprise Support value maps, specializing in SAP Data and Analytics. With a tenure of 12 years at SAP, Caroline’s expertise lies in assisting and guiding customers to succeed through SAP Enterprise Support offerings. 

💡Have questions or feedback on this content? Feel free to leave a comment below or submit them in the Q&A section.

entry.title: Re: What is the menu Migrate in transaction SMOD?
entry.content:
NEVER MIGRATE CUSTOMER EXITS IN SMOD (unless you have created a Z Enhancement in the transaction SMOD, which has been done very rarely by the customers I know).

Only the owners of the definitions of Customer Exits (in SMOD, they are also called Enhancements) should migrate them. If they don't migrate them, you don't have to migrate your own implementations of Customer Exits (CMOD).

If the owners are SAP or other ABAP software providers and they have migrated the definitions of Customer Exits (via the menu "Migrate" in SMOD), the customers will be informed by SPAU (when using it to upgrade SAP software) to migrate the implementations, that's not related to the menu "Migrate" in SMOD.

The note 915122 - Migration of customer exits not allowed in customer systems - SAP for Me says:

  • The migration of the definition side must be executed only by the software provider.
  • The use of transaction SMOD for the migration of SMOD enhancements to BAdIs is prohibited.
  • Therefore, the relevant pushbuttons in transaction SMOD are missing in customer systems.
  • You can use the ok codes "MIG" or "MIGW" to execute or undo the migration.
  • A migration of SMOD enhancements may result in significant development efforts.
  • In this case, however, SAP cannot guarantee further support.

For information, the first screen in SMOD contains the two migration buttons, they are NOT displayed in customer systems, but they are displayed in SAP-owned systems (there's the module MIGRATION_ONLY_AT_SAP in SAPMSMOD):

entry.title: SAP’s New Logistics Management Module: A Cloud-Native Approach to Smarter Regional Supply Chains
entry.content:
What Is SAP Logistics Management?

SAP Logistics Management is a modern SaaS-based logistics solution built on the SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP).
It brings together warehousing, transportation management, and partner collaboration in a single, integrated system — particularly suited for regional or satellite operations — while connecting seamlessly with SAP Cloud ERP and SAP Business Network.

 

 

 

 

 

Image Source: SAP Product Information Page (sap.com)

Key Attributes

  • Cloud-native: Designed for seamless scalability, continuous innovation, and rapid deployment.
  • Unified logistics approach: Combines warehouse, transport execution, orchestration, and partner collaboration into one platform.
  • Native ERP integration: Connects easily with SAP Cloud ERP and SAP S/4HANA without heavy customization.
  • Carrier & partner collaboration: Built-in connectivity through the SAP Business Network for real-time visibility and data sharing.
  • AI-powered operations (Joule): Leverages SAP Joule AI assistants to automate tasks, guide decisions, and reduce manual workload.

In short, SAP Logistics Management doesn’t replace heavy-duty logistics systems like SAP EWM or SAP TM, but rather extends SAP’s portfolio with a lighter, agile, intelligent logistics layer — ideal for regional warehouses and distributed networks.

 

 

 

 

 

Image Source: SAP Product Information Page (sap.com)

Core Capabilities & Business Impact

 

Function

Business Impact

Warehouse & transport execution

Reduces manual coordination and errors

Real-time visibility

Enables proactive decision-making

Dock & appointment scheduling

Improves yard efficiency

AI-guided automation

Speeds up repetitive tasks

Integrated partner collaboration

Boosts transparency across the supply chain

 

Feature Highlights

Feature Area

What It Enables

Why It Matters

Warehouse execution

Pick/pack, wave management, dock scheduling, inventory movements

Smooth internal operations, less idle time

Transportation & dispatching

Route planning, dispatching, and execution

Better shipment coordination

Network collaboration

Real-time status, carrier integration, partner communication

Reduces blind spots, accelerates response

Appointment & dock scheduling

Dock/gate management

Reduces queuing, improves yard efficiency

AI automation (Joule)

Decision support, task automation

Frees up planners and boosts productivity

ERP integration

Out-of-the-box connectivity with SAP Cloud ERP

Minimizes custom development

Scalable deployment

Rapid implementation for smaller logistics nodes

Supports multi-tier logistics networks

 

Positioning Within the SAP Ecosystem

SAP positions this module as a bridge for distributed logistics operations, extending logistics capabilities to smaller or regional nodes. It complements — not replaces — SAP Extended Warehouse Management (EWM) and SAP Transportation Management (TM).

Where It Fits:

SAP Product

Complexity

Ideal For

Deployment

SAP EWM

High

Central hubs

On-prem / Cloud

SAP TM

High

Complex transport networks

On-prem / Cloud

SAP Logistics Management

Medium / Low

Regional / Satellite nodes

Cloud-native

Because it’s built on SAP BTP and integrates with SAP Business Network and Joule AI, the new module aligns with SAP’s vision of an intelligent, integrated supply chain.
SAP announced that general availability is expected in Q1 2026.

Benefits & Business Value

Adopting SAP Logistics Management can deliver both operational and strategic gains:

  1. Reduced operational friction: Unified logistics reduces manual handoffs and integration gaps.
  2. Faster deployment for regional nodes: Cloud-native architecture enables quicker rollouts and lower implementation costs.
  3. Improved visibility & collaboration: Real-time tracking and partner integration enhance transparency and agility.
  4. AI-driven decision support: Joule AI assists planners, automates routine actions, and reduces human error.
  5. Scalable, modular growth: Deploy gradually across logistics nodes without disrupting existing core systems.
  6. Resilient and agile operations: Respond faster to disruptions and maintain consistent service levels.
  7. Network consistency: Standardized processes and data across multiple logistics layers ensure global alignment.

Key Challenges & Considerations

While promising, success depends on thoughtful execution.
Organizations should anticipate and plan for:

  • Scope & complexity limits: The module is optimized for low-to-medium complexity; large hubs may still need EWM + TM.
  • Data integration & master data quality: Consistent, clean master data is critical for seamless performance.
  • Change management: AI-driven workflows require user adoption and training.
  • Phased rollout strategy: Identify pilot nodes and migration paths carefully.
  • Carrier & partner readiness: True collaboration depends on network adoption.
  • Monitoring & exception handling: Maintain human oversight during early automation phases.
  • Cost vs. ROI alignment: Evaluate expected efficiency gains against investment costs.

 

What Businesses Should Do Next

If your organization already runs SAP Cloud ERP or S/4HANA, this launch presents a real opportunity to modernize logistics without starting from scratch.

Recommended Next Steps

  • Map your logistics footprint: Identify which regional or satellite nodes would benefit most.
  • Start with pilot deployments: Test configurations, training, and ROI in smaller sites.
  • Ensure data readiness: Clean up and harmonize master data across materials, locations, and partners.
  • Engage carriers early: Align carriers and logistics partners with the collaboration network from the start.
  • Plan coexistence: Integrate with existing EWM/TM during the transition phase.
  • Adopt AI in stages: Roll out automation features gradually and monitor outcomes.
  • Track KPIs from day one: Measure order throughput, dock utilization, exception rates, and on-time delivery.

Conclusion 

The introduction of SAP Logistics Management marks a pivotal step in SAP’s supply chain evolution — moving toward networked, intelligent, and modular logistics.

With its cloud-native architecture, AI-powered automation, and embedded collaboration, it offers a compelling value proposition for companies with multi-tier logistics footprints.

Ultimately, success will depend on data readiness, partner engagement, and phased adoption — but for organizations ready to embrace intelligent logistics, SAP is clearly paving the way for smarter, more connected supply chains.

Thank you for reading.

entry.title: Employee Business Partner Archival, Deletion, and Recreation in SAP S/4HANA
entry.content:
Introduction
In SAP, Business Partners (BPs) are central master data objects shared across multiple modules. This blog explains how to safely delete and recreate an Employee Business Partner using a new number range—without affecting the employee record or related applications, while also allowing the old number range to be reused for other Business Partners, such as customers and vendors.

Step-by-Step Resolution
Step 1:  Delete Communication Detail (Infotype 105 Subtype 0001) from Employee
To delete Infotype 105 (Communication Details) and Subtype 0001 (System User): For a single employee, go to transaction PA30, select the infotype(105) and subtype (0001), then click the Delete icon. For mass deletions, LSMW can be created and used.

Step 2:  Decouple BP and User
Although we deleted the communication details in the previous step, the Business Partner remains connected to the User ID. To disconnect the Business Partner from the User, run the standard program RSUID_REMOVE_FALSE_BP_ASGN in transaction SE38. Enter the User ID in the input field and execute the program. Then, select the record, click "Convert", and choose "Convert to Classic User".

 



Step 2 can only be executed if Step 1 has been completed.If not, you will receive the following error: "No users found in the selected area."

⚠️  After this step, the email address and telephone number will be removed from the user in transaction SU01. To restore this information efficiently, you can use LSMW to perform a mass import of those details.

Step 3:  Set Deletion/Archiving Flag
Go to transaction BUPA_PRE_DA. Enter the Business Partner number in the Business Partner input field. Select the "To be deleted" radio button. Check the boxes for "Can be deleted" and "Can be archived". Select the "Set Flag" radio button. Click Execute.

Step 4: Remove CP (Central Person) and BP (Business Partner) Relationship
The Central Person (CP) is a technical object used to uniquely link an employee’s personnel record (PERNR) to other related objects like User and Business Partner. The Central Person is automatically generated by the system. This is stored in the HRP1001 table.
The relationship between BP and CP is B207. Get the CP ID from the HRP1001 table for the desired Business Partner. This can be deleted using the standard program RHRHDC00.


Step 5: Set Central Block / End of Purpose (EOP)
Prerequisite:

  • ILM configurations must be in place to execute this step.
  • If any changes are made to the Business Partner, the central block cannot be applied on the same day — it must be performed on the following day.
  • If business partner is locked in any applications or open transactions, EOP cannot be executed.

To set central block, go to transaction BUPA_PRE_EOP, Give the business partner ID and execute.

Step 6:  Write Archiving File
Go to transaction SARA and enter CA_BUPA in the Archiving Object field. Choose the WRITE option and create a variant.  Provide the Business Partner ID that has to be deleted, set ILM Actions to Archiving, and select the execution mode — either Production or Test.

Once done, click on Attributes at the top and enter a suitable description, then save again. Set the Start Date to Immediate and define the Spool Parameters as LP01. Execute the job, then navigate to Job Overview, open the Spool List, and review the results.

Step 7:  Delete the Archived File
Once the archiving file is written, go to transaction SARA again. Select CA_BUPA in the Archiving Object field and choose the DELETE option. The file created in the previous step will be displayed. Select it and execute the deletion.



Step 8: Set New Number Range
Go to transaction SNRO and set a new number range.

Step 9:  Create Communication Detail (Infotype 105 – Subtype 0001)
To create Infotype 105 (Communication Details) and Subtype 0001 (System User): For a single employee, go to transaction PA30 and create Infotype 105 with Subtype 0001. For mass creation, an LSMW can be created and used.

Step 10:  Run BP Sync Program
Run the BP sync program /SHCM/RH_SYNC_BUPA_EMPL_SINGLE with the desired Employee ID. A new Business Partner will be created and synced with the User.

Conclusion
By following these steps, you can safely delete and recreate Employee Business Partners without terminating any employee records. The End of Purpose (EOP) report helps identify open transactions preventing deletion. Once recreated under a new number range, conflicts are resolved and the old range becomes reusable for other Business Partners.



Sources:
BP Archival and deletion using SARA: https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/archiving-of-business-partner/ba-p/13858643

Business Partner Number Range Configuration: https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-s-4hana-business-partner-general-number-settings/ba-p/13529505

ILM Configuration: https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/how-to-schedule-an-ilm-job-for-deleting-employee-data/ba-p/13875544

Set Archiving and Deletion Flag using BUPA_PRE_DA:
 https://help.sap.com/docs/TRBK_S4HANA_EARLIER/29cd80be37ea41bab809abb791cea909/4e8e95bc034f1f35e10000000a42189d.html?locale=en-US

Remove the Business Partner and User Relationship using the standard program RSUID_REMOVE_FALSE_BP_ASGN  : Delete BP for existing Employee and User in S/4HAN... - SAP Community

Delete BP and CP Relationship: https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-q-a/report-to-delete-om-objects/qaq-p/5508187

End of Purpose: 
https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_SUPPLIER_RELATIONSHIP_MANAGEMENT/c8a1f0f380454446bb88b07dee132c73/4dc8387e27e14814be489df740119966.html?locale=en-US

entry.title: How to Mark Materials for Deletion in SAP Ariba Product Sourcing (Related to DMS-18783)
entry.content:
Hello Experts, 

We're investigating whether it's possible to delete or deactivate Product Sourcing materials that are no longer in use or were mistakenly uploaded. We found documentation about Product Sourcing functionality DMS-18783, which prevents materials marked for deletion from appearing in product sourcing searches and being added to product sourcing events.
DMS-18783: Prevent Adding Deleted Materials to Product Sourcing Events | SAP Help Portal
This suggests there's a way to mark materials for deletion in Product Sourcing, but we haven't been able to find how to do so. We'd greatly appreciate your feedback on whether this is possible.
If this isn't possible, we'd greatly appreciate information on how other customers work around the inability to delete materials in Product Sourcing, including any operational workarounds they use.

What we've tried so far:
We tested in our demo system and contacted SAP Support, but haven't found a solution.

  • We couldn't find documentation on how to mark materials for deletion.

  • SAP Support confirmed that Sourcing material master data cannot be manually modified via CSV uploads (this is only possible in Procurement solutions like Ariba Buying & Invoicing) and no manual import or delete task exists in the Sourcing admin UI.

  • We marked a test material for deletion in our SAP backend demo system and uploaded it with the incremental load option using the ARBCIG_MASTER_DATA_EXPORT program. However, it was automatically excluded, even though the material was in the sourcing material prefilter.

  • SAP Support confirmed that the deletion flag for materials in S/4HANA isn't automatically processed in Ariba Sourcing. It appears that only programs for uploading B&I master data (such as ARBCIG_BUYER_CATALOG_EXPORT and ARBCIG_BUYER_CATALOG_REPORT) support deletion flag information integration as standard functionality.
    About Processing Purchase Information Records and Material Master Records | SAP Help Portal

We'd appreciate your response. 

Best Regards,
Chinatsu

SAP Ariba Strategic Sourcing Suite

entry.title: Re: Business Content - Installation, Activation & Transpo...
entry.content:
Hi

You can't use eclipse to install bw4 business content. You should use SAP GUI in BW4 with classical transaction RSOR 

You can easily find tutorials online or sap standard online help regarding every step of this process (trxRSOR) e.g selection of proper contents/flows upward, downward/ collection and trasport  ) 

hope it helps
